details: A ridge cap is a special type of tile that covers the intersection between the edges of your roof tiles. It is usually situated at the highest point of your roof. The ridge cap effectively seals any crevices on your roof tiles and prevents water from seeping inside of them.
details2: Ridge caps are attached to your roof through bedding and pointing. Bedding is a mixture of mortar, sand, and/or cement that is applied to the ridge cap like glue so that it sits firmly in place. Pointing is a flexible material for sealing the joints between the ridge cap and surrounding tiles.
